properties.name: ACE Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 1022 SW Stark St, Portland, OR 97205Incredibly hip hotel blocks from Powell\'s and the Pearl district. Vintage photobooth in the lobby, rooms ranging from deluxe suites to Euro-style shared bathrooms, and a Stumptown coffee next door.

properties.name: Acorn Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  539 NW 13th Ave, Portland, OR 97209"Micro-deli" and sister cafe to Half & Half coffee, they have a friendly staff, coffee roasted by Courier Coffee (a lone coffee fanatic who roasts in his backyard and delivers by bike) and the best pie in town.

properties.name: BEAST
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 5425 NE 30th Ave, Portland, OR 97211Decadent, yet casual and warm, prix fixe restaurant serving French countryside-by-way-of-Portland-Farmer\'s -Market fare. Two communal tables, one menu per night, COMPLETELY open kitchen. Just awesome.

properties.name: Barbur World Foods
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda9845 SW Barbur Blvd, Portland, Or

properties.name: Belmont Station
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  4500 SE Stark St, Portland, OR 97215Best bottle shop in Portland - super friendly staff, amazing selection of bombers and belgians and hard-to-find brews, plus hundreds of beers available by the keg.

properties.name: Biwa
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 214 SE 9th Ave, Portland, ORJapanese soul-food comes to PDX. Ramen, udon, housemade kimchi, grilled skewers of lamb and salt-roasted saba. Wash it down with a Sapporo.

properties.name: Broder
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 2508 SE Clinton, Portland, OR 97214Nearly perfect breakfast. Scandinavian "bords" with pickled veg, cured meats, soft cooked eggs, toasts, cheeses, granola. They also have a killer lamb burger. Hip and cozy.

properties.name: Bullseye Gallery
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 300 NW 13th Ave, Portland, OR 97209Not your mother\'s blown Chihuly here - a very contemporary, predominantly kilnformed glass gallery. It carries artists who make cast-glass hand grenades, black & white photographic cameo-engravings and 42 foot long spiraling glass walls.

properties.name: City Market
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  735 NW 21st Ave, Portland, ORLocal gourmet grocer - fine wines, cheeses, produce, Viande meat counter (from Simpatica), and Newman\'s Fish Company. Fresh pastas and ravioli. Molto italiano.

properties.name: Clyde Common
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  1014 SW Stark St, Portland, OR 97205Man the media in this town can\'t help but out-review each other. Blogs, both weeklies, the daily and the monthly magazine all have hyped this place in the span of two weeks. When we went, it was the kind of place that is cool, but makes you feel cooler and more attractive for being there. Our drinks were solid, the bartender was friendly and knowledgeable and our happy hour bites were delicious. We\'re excited to return and try some of the offal coming out of the kitchen.

properties.name: Dalo's Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 4134 N. Vancouver Ave, Portland, OR 97217Great Ethiopian food and the prices are crazy low! The vegetarian combo of all four veg dishes is only 8 bucks! And you can\'t beat that sour injera bread.

properties.name: Fire On the Mountain Wings
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 4225 N Interstate Ave, Portland, OR 97217 Portland\'s only all-wing restaurant featuring 12 sauces (five variations on the classic buffalo sauce, their own soon-to-be-famous spicy peanut, and a bevy of rotating choices). Plus, they run a biodiesel veggie-oil pick-up!

properties.name: Flavourspot.
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda N. Mississippi and N. Fremont, Portland, ORWaffle cart at the corner of Mississippi and Fremont. Second outpost of the N. Lombard operation. Over-the-top waffle sandwiches, cheap, decent drip coffee, swell people

properties.name: Foundation Garments, Inc.
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 2712 NE Alberta St, Portland, OR 97211

properties.name: Hopworks Urban Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 2944 Se Powell Blvd, Portland, OROrganic beers, bike-friendy and good, green design. Total Portland. Get the Seven-grain stout.

properties.name: Ken's Artisan Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  326 nw 21st, portlandAmazing bakery - friendly staff, crusty bread, sublime pastries. The morning bun (brioche with orange zest) and Monday night pizza are reason enough to go.

properties.name: Kennedy School Hotel and Brewery
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda   5736 NW 33rd Ave, Portland, OR 97211Quirky (and uniquely Portland) hotel owned by the McMenamin\'s chain of local brewpubs. A former schoolhouse on the edge of the Alberta/Killingsworth neighborhood, bedrooms have chalkboards, the event space is an old gymnasium and they have an honors bar (non-smoking, cocktails) and a detention room (cigars and whiskey).

properties.name: Kenny & Zukes
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 1038 SW Stark St., Portland, ORHousemade smoked pastrami, bagels, smoke fish and other great deli staples. A and I can already attest to the "Ken\'s Special" - basically a Reuben with chicken liver spread - it\'s smoky, sweet, rich and tangy. In the bottom of the Ace Hotel.

properties.name: Le Pigeon
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 738 E. Burnside St, Portland, OR 97214A good restaurant knows the value of pigs. This place serves waffles with maple-braised pork belly and apricot cornbread with maple ice cream and candied bacon. AND THAT IS JUST BREAKFAST! It blows your mind, doesn\'t it?

properties.name: Liza Rietz & A Broken Spoke
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 2305 NW Savier St, Portland, OR

properties.name: Local 35
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 3556 SE Hawthorne Blvd, Portland, Or 97214Sexy, urban fashions for men and women. Some of the very best tailored lines coming out from small creative designers.

properties.name: Lovely Hula Hands
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 4057 N. Mississippi, Portland, ORAdorable restaurant in the great Mississippi neighborhood. The food and drinks (and the skin on that fried chicken) are worth the trek across a bridge.

properties.name: Lucky Labrador Beer Hall
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  1945 NW Quimby, Portland, ORLucky Labrador Beer Hall (503) 517-4352

properties.name: Mint/820
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 816 N. Russell St, Portland, OR 97227Some of the best cocktails in town - loads of fresh ingredients, herbal infusions and fruit purees. Bartender Lucy Brennan has had a hand in crafting many of the better drink menus in Portland.

properties.name: New Old Lompoc NW
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  1616 NW 23rd Ave, Portland, ORGood local brewery with killer IPAs and pints on Mondays!

properties.name: OFFICE
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  2204 NE Alberta St, Portland, ORHipster office-supply store and art gallery.

properties.name: Olio United
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda1028 SE Water Ave, Portland, OR

properties.name: PDX Contemporary Art
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 925 NW Flanders Portland Or 97209Hands-down one of the best contemporary galleries in town. Showcasing many great local talents, take a look at Storm Tharp, James Lavadour and Brad Adkins\' work in particular.

properties.name: Pix Patisserie (North)
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 3901 N. Williams, Portland, OR 97227Belgian ales, monkey stuffed animals, decadent desserts like a chocolate-pear-rosemary tart or the Shazam! - salted almonds, carmel and chocolate torte enrobed in a sheet of dark chocolate. They even have a beer float (Rogue Chocolate Stout with mocha ice cream).

properties.name: Podnah's Pit BBQ
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 1469 NE Prescott St, Portland, OR 97211Easily some of the best barbecue we\'ve had in PDX. Texas style dry-rubs, smoked in a pit from 5 am, homemade blue-cheese dressing, and a pecan pie made with butter, leaf lard, and cane syrup. They start running out of popular items around 7.

properties.name: PokPok
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 3226 SE Division St, Portland, OR

properties.name: Portland Farmer's Market
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda   SW Park Ave & SW Montgomery St, Portland, OR 97201The central city farmer\'s market - runs 8:30am - 2pm Saturdays, April through December. Great local farmers and producers of everything from chocolates to cheeses, pates, and wines. Not a bad place for a morning snack, either - wood-oven asparagus pizzas, anyone?

properties.name: Powell's City of Books
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 1005 W Burnside Portland, OR 97209A full city-block of books. Serious.

properties.name: Roots Organic Brewing
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  1520 SE 7th Ave, Portland, OROne of the most innovative breweries in town. While the vibe is a bit crunchy, the beers are amazing (and organic), whether its the Heather beer (no hops, just Scottish heather), the chamomile-lavender kolsch, or just a really solid IPA.

properties.name: Saint Cupcake
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 407 Nw 17th Ave, Portland, ORSublime little treats with the best damn cream cheese frosting ever. Making an appearance at our wedding? You\'ll just have to wait and see.

properties.name: Seaplane Clothing
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 827 NW 23rd Ave, Portland, ORLocal clothing store that serves as a showcase of young, local designers. Hip designs and lots of creatively recycled fabrics.

properties.name: Simpatica Catering
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 828 SE Ash St, Portland, OR 97214Supper club, butcher and our caterer!

properties.name: Steve's Cheese
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  2321 NW Thurman St, Portland, OR 97210Our favorite little cheese shop in town. Steve and his team know their stuff and select amazing cheeses, keeping them at perfect conditions. Throw in their great condiments, honeys and gourmet foods and you\'ve got a great little shop. Plus, it\'s in the back of a really nice wine shop - Square Deal Wines.

properties.name: Stumptown Coffee Roasters (Ace Hotel)
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda   1022 SW Stark, Portland, ORNewest location of PDX\'s best coffee roasters. Amazing espresso and any bean they roast available as a cup of coffee, brewed while-you-wait in one of their fleet of high-speed Clover machines.

properties.name: Stumptown Coffee Roasters (Belmont)
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 3356 SE Belmont St Portland, OR 97214Best coffee in PDX, roasted and brewed. The Annex next door does daily cuppings of all their beans and will geek out over proper brewing techniques with you.

properties.name: Stumptown Coffee Roasters (Downtown)
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  128 SW 3rd Ave Portland, OR 97204Best coffee in PDX, roasted and brewed. Mod furniture, great beer, huge magazine rack.

properties.name: Tender Loving Empire
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 1720 NW Lovejoy St, #109, Portland, OR 97209Cute husband-and-wife silkcreen shop, small-scale record label and indie store. Great small press stuff, t-shirts and funny little things like crocheted sushi.

properties.name: Toro Bravo
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 120 NE Russell St., Portland, OR 97212Finally, a tapas place in PDX that doesn\'t have pan-Asian cuisine alongside Mediterranean staples. Solid interpretations of regional Spanish specialties. The drinks were great, the tapas were amazing and the paellas were great (try any with the fideos). Portions (especially of the vegetable tapas) are filling.

properties.name: Ya Hala
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 8005 SE Stark, Portland ORHands down the best Lebanese food in town - amazingly smoky and tangy baba ghanouj, loads of tahini, and unbeatably fluffy fresh pitas. A lot of vegan and vegetarian options, too. Connected to a Middle Eastern import store next door.

properties.name: cork
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda  2901 NE Alberta St, Portland, OR 97211Nicest wine shop in town - hundreds of interesting bottles under twenty dollars, regular tastings and gourmet vittles.

properties.name: ¿Por Qué No? Taqueria
properties.description: Posted by Stumptownpanda 3524 N Mississippi Ave, Portland, OR 97227Sweet little taqueria in Mississippi neighborhood. Nice mix of tacos and tamales - a great place to cool off with a michelada Tecate on a hot day.
